values:
So I woke up this morning to the smell of heavy smoke. I debated for a while whether I should call someone since I didn't see a fire anywhere. Eventually I gave in and called. Thankfully, well not so thankfully for the people involved, a tractor trailer caught on fire about a mile or so away so it wasn't anything to worry about other than the horrid smell. Seriously though, what a way to start the day.

This is not a good start to Friday the 13th, but I'm not supersitious...honest...

Well, it would be if I wasn't just wishful thinking. Long day again today. I really am beginning to despise them. At least tomorrow _is_ Friday. Thank Faranth! I can't wait, for so many reasons. This week has dragged by horribly, horribly slow. Aren't busy days supposed to go by fast?

I can't wait until Friday! This week has been so busy but it's dragged by. I know that it's because I'm excited for Ally to come up here. She won't be here until later on Friday night but I'm looking forward to it. Looks like it's going to rain so we'll have to change our plans. Ally suggested trying to catch whatever they're playing at the Imax theatre and seeing the Natural History Museum while we're at it. I'm sure we'll find something else fun to do this weekend as well. Now if the week could just be over and then, eventually, for the school year to be going.

Oh, and I have a job interview next Tuesday. So wish me luck! And wish me luck that I get back fast enough not to miss class.

It needs to be Friday. Why isn't it Friday yet? And why is the week so stinking busy? It's not fair. I have other things I wanted to be doing this week and I'm not sure how I'm going to fit it all in. Oh well, hopefully this week will go by fast although it's not looking that way so far.

Is it to much to ask to expect the school to give an explanation when the Internet goes out all day, or the power for hours, or the running water?! Last night we had barely any running water, some of the dorms had no running water period and this happened for half the campus. Do we get an explanation? No. No email to apologize or anything. At the most we might find out next week in the paper but I doubt it.

On a less ranty note...next weekend can't come fast enough. I can't wait! Of course I have a lot of school work to do between now and then. Maybe I'll be good and get some done over the weekend even though I'm going home for the weekend.

I feel accomplished, well sorta. I sent in another resume for a job and I got rid of the telemarketer that has been stubbornly trying to get me to answer the phone for weeks. You'd think they'd get the hint after the first week of me ignoring them, but no, I finally had to pick up the phone and tell them to stop calling. Geesh. Now I just need to do some homework and then I'll be good.

On a different note I still look like a chipmunk (real sexy I assure you). I'm not hurting too much at the moment but I haven't tried eating anything lately. I had way too many vivid (and very odd) dreams last night for any proper rest but I'll probably still be heading back to school tonight. *yawns* so tired.

Okay, so I don't generally consider myself in the radical man-hater camp but every time I go downstairs to use the laundry room or to pop some popcorn I remember why I have no use for men. Seriously, drawing penises and writing obcene things on the walls? Smearing food on the floors, walls and stairs? Who does that? Drunk college boys is who.

Repeatedly. 

It also smells down there, and not the normal musty, icky smell the dorm has anyway. I'm starting to think they weren't being so subtle when they made the only floor with the laundry room for the whole dorm into an all male floor. Sadly they seem to have missed the irony. *rolls eyes*

Well *knock on wood* I have to say that this has been the best year in a long time. Especially the second half of the year. I even managed to do well this last semester in advanced stats which I was afraid I'd have to repeat for a while there (okay, so I panic too easily about grades). I've caught up with a lot of friends and made new ones. I've been a hell of a lot happier than I have in the last few years and it's an absolutely wonderful feeling. I've been writing a lot, which makes me feel productive and happy. 

Now, I need to get through another semester, this one looks to be very busy with research methods, french, and linguistics. Then I need to find an internship or something for the summer. Hopefully I'll get to go on vacation too over the summer. 

Anyway, here's to a good year for all of us. Hopefully a better one for those of you who have had a hard time. *hugs you all*

Well, on the one hand I'm disappointed that the "marriage" amendment passed. Very disappointed if not surprised. But we have the House back and for the moment Webb is in the lead (but just barely). Either way we're almost certainly headed for a recount. So we'll see.

I never thought I'd hear dad cry. My grandfather was diagnosed with cancer a few months ago and he's had dementia for a while as well. Yet all through him going out to help and talking with his family on the phone and all he never cried in front of me. 

Today my grandfather died. It's slowly hitting me but between not really being there with the dementia and barely eating, he was wasting away so at least now he's at peace. My dad called me to let me know, and of course I knew before he said it because we'd been expecting it and I heard his voice sort of break. Then he called my mom and apparently cried when he told her. 

It's odd because I'm so used to my dad being the outwardly strong one when there are upsetting things going on, but it is his dad. 

Anyway, I regret not being able to go out to pay my respects, but in my own way I'm doing so by remembering the good times we had together, the good memories. I just wish I could see my mom this weekend since dad will be driving out there.

It must be my lucky day! I just won two codestones on tombola on neopets and 2000 np on the Wheel of Excitement.

Er...obviously lucky is a relative term, but still cool : )

*bounces* I get to go see horses tomorrow and hopefully ride *dances* Let's just hope I don't break anything considering I'm exhausted and haven't ridden in over a year but I can't pass up the opportunity! *wiggles*

A pen runs out of ink and a funeral is held to honor it complete with a rendition of Taps. Faranth knows what would happen if one of the computers ever completely stopped working.

Addendum:

Another coworker was on the phone with a guy and the word "Levia" came up in the conversation (don't ask how) and he said it sounded like "lesbian" for some reason and proceeded to tell the coworker that he was a lesbian to. *blinks* The explanation is probably way more than I want to know. Probably a sign it should be time to go home.

So, as further proof I'm not allowed near anything ambiguous when I'm in a silly mood, the other day mom and I were in the car and I happened to be making a call for her on her phone. When I ended the call there was this polar bear background on it that I hadn't notice before. 

Come to discover she didn't put the polar bear there (my brother did), just as well as the polar bear was leaned over a large mound of snow and suspiciously like it was humping the snow. 

As if that wasn't bad enough...I decided to go find out what other fun images she had in her phone and found a two cartoony images. One was of (what I assume was) two bears hugging although the picture was so tiny I wasn't entirely sure other than it was vaguely obscene. 

Not _nearly_ so bad as the next image, however. This one was of a man playing a guitar (or something similar) and singing to a sheep. This begs the question...Why was this man serenading the sheep? Is he perhaps from West Virginia or New Zealand?  And why is this picture on a phone that also has pictures of a polar bear humping a snow mound and two bears getting a little too friendly? I mean these _came_ with the phone (*coughs* pun not intended, honest.) 

Mmmm, I think I just need to get my mind out of the gutter.

As if it wasn't bad enough they decided to clean the gutters and things at 8:30 on my day off, now they're pounding around Right. Next. to my window. 
 If they break my window by accident I'm not going to be happy. I rather like my window...closed...it's going to be almost 100 degrees out today. I do _not_ want my window broken ever, but especially not with it being that hot out.

http://applegeeks.com/lite/index.php?aglitecomic=2006-06-09

*g* I'm not _quite_ this bad as I drool over possibilities for my new laptop. At least I don't think I am.

Well,

I normally don't use the internet in the few minutes before I have to start work, but I couldn't resist making a quick note on the crazy music stuff I've been hearing on the radio lately. Yesterday it was the Christmas music in July. Today it was music CDs for pets. I've heard of the concept before but today I got the joy of listening to some of the snippets from the CD "Music That Makes Dogs Happy" or something similar to that.

Let me just say that when the first snippet they play is from a song called "Squeaky Deaky" or some such it's all down hill from there. They also played "I Like It When You Scratch Me" and "I Like Food." 

Anyway, I'll get more to that later when I can try and scrounge up the website address.

So I turned on the radio today while in the car and I heard Christmas music. Quite certain I was imagining things I turned up the sound. Nope, still playing Christmas music. So I thought maybe it was actually a commercial. An odd choice of music for a commercial but it's happened before. Only...no...it was an an honest to god, by Faranth, Christmas Music...in July...where a good majority of the month has been near 90 degrees.

In our area we have a station that goes from playing it's normal music to playing all Christmas music, all day long, every day from not long after Halloween until a few days after Christmas. No joking, no kidding. 

And no apparently they think we should be hearing nothing but Christmas music in July for a couple of days in a row to help us "cool down". I mean I've heard of Christmas in July before, but whoever came up with this idea needs to be smacked.

Well, I've been a bit quiet about but my grandpa had his surgery Friday. Turns out the cancer has attached to his aorta and spread to a bunch of organs (although three doctors have looked at it and can't figure out what type he has). We pretty much knew that already but that doesn't make it easier. It's really very sad, even though he was never really the same after his stroke when I was little it's worse now. They say six months although for his sake and my grandma's I hope it's not that long and that he doesn't suffer more than he has to.  

I haven't seen my grandparents since around my 19th birthday. That wasn't exactly the greatest trip (now there's an understatement) and I feel bad that I haven't really had a chance to go back. I'll prolly try and go out for a few days towards August if I can. I was going to go for the 4th of July but I misunderstood dad's plans and so couldn't end up going. Chris wanted to go too but he's been working a lot and he'd only just gotten back a week or so earlier from helping build homes in Alaska (yes, Alaska) for 10 days.
well I get up early all ready to finish doing my reading for today and I find out my class has been cancelled...oh well I'm not complaining
hehehehe "I tell all the guys you can do whatever you want with my daughter, but remember...whatever you do to my daughter I'm going to do to you."
shit....I don't even know what to say to that *falls over laughing* I really, really don't....but it's sharding funny.

*eg* we've got 75 degree temperatures down here *wriggles* I actually got hot walking between the school store and my dorm.  Back home it's 30 degrees colder...too bad I'll be back home tomorrow *sighs* I like the weather down here better
*wriggles* Micah by Laurell K. Hamilton is out, I know what I'm doing when I get home tomorrow. Need something to read over spring break after all
and...so much for going to bed early...or even on time *sighs* at least hopefully this damn thing is done correctly

In a very blond moment I completely forgot that I had my jump drive to transfer a file between my laptop (which must have been dropped on its head when it was being made) and my desktop so I was trying to update my laptop so the school network would let it access the internet properly which is a headache in itself. unfortunately my laptop is the only thing I'll have for internet over the break when my dad's home from work...that makes me really sad.
wow...I'm all for lobbying and trying to change people's minds...but there's a point where it becomes an exercise in futility....*blinks*

In  the last 12 hours I have had one thing to eat...and one thing only.

Anyone want to take a guess as to what it was?

I went to see GoF tonight on campus which was put on through their Cheap Seats program and they always give away door prizes before each movie. Normally they give out raffle tickets, but not today.

No, today they made a call for 5 volunteers. Me being naive assumed they were going to ask trivia questions. Wrong. Instead each of us had to try one Bertie Botts Every Flavour Beans bean and keep it down and identify it.

I ended up getting....

the earthworm flavored bean and I don't reccomend it as a dinner entree.
*bounces* 30% off coupon for Borders. You can never have enough books
Wow...the guy who plays House (too tired to remember his name) sounds so weird in his native language

note: T'rif's third child...ask Shir 

Dea his little mistress that he thought was Wygelle had a girl but never named her

Archive diving can be interesting....I've found some things I'd completely forgotten, remembered why some things ended up happening later, and sighed or laughed over some other things....some of the scenes with Sar and Kass were so cute (when they and L'tul weren't trying to kill each other)

You'd think yesterday would have taught me Not. To. Put. Things. In. My. Pocket. But it didn't...Because I wasn't wearing a jacket or my normal sweatshirt I put my ipod there while I was getting lunch...it must have fallen out. Luckily someone was nice enough to  turn it in and I got it back. From not on I'm not allowed to handle anything expensive if it ways less than 25 pounds unless it is glued to my body.
okay whose bright idea was it to schedule a fireworks display in Feburary?
*bounces* Well I just got something that made my day (and no it has nothing to do with sex). *bounces*

good night world : ) and if there's not a good 8 inches on the ground when I wake up tomorrow I'm going to sic Dakota on the weatherpeople and punish Kev and both Katies for stealing my snow (apparently people with K names like to steal snow)
SNOW! Finally! (It'd better stick or I'll never believe a weather man ever again)
I'm not allowed to debate any more...I managed to interject occam's razor and Murphy's law into a debate just now, and now I have the urge to try to fit in chaos theory some how.
Just a random thought...there's something seriously wrong with the maintenance men on campus having to mow the grass in _January_.

me: somewhere (around here I think) there was a bank robber, he was caught because his liscence plate read...got a guess?
Kev: "IROBBNX"
Me: no : ) "FINDME"

"On a more amusing note:  I just remembered another instance of tiny
dogs gone wild.  How about the Yorkie who ran his own handler over
with a flock of sheep, not once, but several times?"


-quote from a person of a list I'm on after the issue of tiny dog terrors came up

"Any member introducing a dog into the Society's premises shall be
liable to a fine of one pound. Any animal leading a blind person shall
be deemed to be a cat." - Rule 46, Oxford Union Society, London

http://edinburghnews.scotsman.com/uk.cfm?id=2448992005

Harry Potter saves children

HARRY Potter stops children having accidents, according to new research published today.

The research shows the number of children being treated in hospital after accidents fell on the weekends that Harry Potter books were released.

Researchers at John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford studied attendance records for children aged seven to 15 at the hospital's emergency department over summer weekends between 2003 and 2005.

Writing in today's edition of the British Medical Journal, they say they found that the number nearly halved on the two weekends in June 2003 and July 2005 when "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix" and "Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince" were published.

good news for student gay rights

I thought this was interesting...it's an email time capsule where if you happen to have the same email address down the line you can receive your email letter to yourself back. 

http://forbes.codefix.net/capsule/

from The Bullet article "When I Become President of UMW...Part Two":
There's been a lot said about illegal downloading happening on college campuses all over the nation. That's why I'll take away the internet, because it's dirty.

then, since we're supposedly number 3 of the most depressed campuses in the U.S.

- "I'll order the clowns that run [Facebook] make is so that that everyone in this school is friends with everyone else. This massive self-esteem boost for everyone on campus should be enough to stop the depression epidemic. That is, until we turn off the internet."

yesterday I was thinking "You know what, I bet we have a fire drill at one o'clock in the morning" last night and then I thought "yeah, right, like they're going to choose tonight just because I thought it" and what happens? I get jolted out of bed at 1 in the morning (I'm sure within ten minutes of the time I finally fell asleep) to the sound of the fire alarm

oooo and on a random note (as if the last _wasn't_ random) I'm going to the International Horse Show Friday. yay! And come next Tuesday it will _finally_ be November...Just three more Fridays after that...
